page.title: 14 Redenham Park.
page.content:
Much of the area of the block is taken up by the two thousand{acres}which comprise the{Redenham Park. }It is a privately owned and run estate engaged in forestry, animal husbandry and general{farming. }There are six hundred{acres}of woodland and racehorses are bred and trained here.
The{farming}comprises cereal crops and cattle and to a large extent reflects the wider aspect of the whole area. There is a large private{house approached by two long drives and still remote from the{roads}and more crowded civilisation even in these over-populated days. There are many fine examples of established specimen {trees}such as oak, cedar and sycamore. Many elms have disappeared, killed by {Dutch Elm disease}which swept the country during the nineteen-seventies.
